items.title: Using alt text to make science Twitter more accessible for people with visual impairments
items.desc: Co-written with Dr. Domenico Chiarella and Dr. Christopher Jackson, this article examines how alt text can be used on science-based Twitter posts to make them more accessible to people with visual impairments.

items.title: British Airways World Traveler Plus Ticks the Boxes for TATL
items.desc: Trip report on flights from Austin to Naples, Italy via London on British Airways.

items.title: Op-Ed: Airlines should follow United lead on seatback IFE accessibility
items.desc: Article discussing a newly-announced seatback in-flight entertainment system United was beginning to install that has a plethora of accessibility features, including a built-in screen reader, screen magnification, and assistance for color blind passengers.

items.title: Op-Ed: DOT made the right call with service animal guidance
items.desc: Article discussing guidance provided by the US Department of Transportation on flying with service animals. Note that this guidance pre-dates the DOT rule-making discussed in later articles.

items.title: Op-Ed: DOT NPRM could discourage service animal owners from traveling
items.desc: Article reacting to the proposed rules for traveling with service animals that were issued by the US Department of Transportation while the proposal was open for comment.

items.title: Flying blind in a post-pandemic world - it’s complicated
items.desc: Article speaking to blind people about their thoughts on traveling by air just as air travel was beginning to rebound during the COVID-19 pandemic.

items.title: United impresses with accessible app for the blind
items.desc: Article examining recent updates to United's iPhone app in which United touted all the accessibility improvements that were made.

items.title: DOT service animal rule lifts some proposed burdens on handlers
items.desc: Article examining the new rules adopted by the DOT surrounding flying with service animals.

items.title: Exploring airline form accessibility for service animal handlers
items.desc: Examining the accessibility of the forms used to submit service animal information soon after the new rules for flying with service animals were adopted. The issues that were identified with United and Alaska's forms have since been resolved.

items.title: Minor hiccups aside, United strives to be accessible for the blind
items.desc: Trip report on flights from Phoenix to Houston and back On United's 737 MAX 9 in late April 2021.

items.title: Why US animal relief areas are ripe for improvement
items.desc: Article discussing experiences with service animal relief areas in airports and how they could be improved.

items.title: How United’s accessible in-seat IFE lives up to expectations
items.desc: Trip report for flights between Phoenix and Houston on United's 737 MAX 8 equipped with the accessible in-flight entertainment system United started rolling out to their fleet in 2019.

items.title: Op-Ed: Sensory overload and the case for quieter airports
items.desc: Article examining my personal experiences with sensory overload in airports and strategies that airports, airlines, and travelers can use to mitigate it.

items.title: Why United's decision to add Braille in cabins is profound
items.desc: Article looking at United's recent announcement that they have begun installing Braille signage throughout their mainline aircraft.

items.desc: Introduction to using alt text on different social media platforms.
